Text:
Hi, unfortunately there seems to be something with files # 3, 4, 7, 8, 9 and 11.
I've tried to convert them to wave for burning, but when I do, they are empty.
J.
To play, burn and convert, use http://www.mediamonkey.com/product.htm
PS: There is nothing wrong with the files.

I too had problems with buring these flacs on a CD-R with regular Nero and Easy CD-DA Extractor 10. Then I tried a more powerful/flexible RiverPast Audio Converter 7.2, and converted all flacs to wavs successfully and then burnt the set on a disk alright. Sounds perfect. There you go.
He gone be more than half dead if he dont fill my mu-fu-in drink up!

Amazing! Thanks!
Nothing wrong here, either, Syd was jangling away in 15 minutes flat.

To: norsee


When i opened the torrent, it was all flac files and whatnot and my media players wouldn't open the files, kept saying they were corrupt and i read your post and i got Mediamonkey and its perfect! Thanks alot dude, you really helped me out, also, thanks for the torrent, i really appreciated it. :)
Pig man pig charade you are

To Nevodaniel: winamp can play flacs natively.

Hi!
I tried to convert the files with flac 1.2.1 (command line and frontend) and did not work. Seem to be some problems with the headers. Maybe media mokey did something that the others codecs do not understand.
